00015  * solver, CVDIAG.
00016  * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00017  */
00018 
00019 #ifndef _CVDIAG_H
00020 #define _CVDIAG_H
00021 
00022 #ifdef __cplusplus  /* wrapper to enable C++ usage */
00023 extern "C" {
00024 #endif
00025 
00026 #include <sundials/sundials_nvector.h>
00027 
00028 /*
00029  * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00030  * Function : CVDiag
00031  * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00032  * A call to the CVDiag function links the main integrator with
00033  * the CVDIAG linear solver.
00034  *
00035  * cvode_mem is the pointer to the integrator memory returned by
00036  *           CVodeCreate.
00037  *
00038  * The return value of CVDiag is one of:
00039  *    CVDIAG_SUCCESS   if successful
00040  *    CVDIAG_MEM_NULL  if the cvode memory was NULL
00041  *    CVDIAG_MEM_FAIL  if there was a memory allocation failure
00042  *    CVDIAG_ILL_INPUT if a required vector operation is missing
00043  * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00044  */
00045 
00046 int CVDiag(void *cvode_mem);
00047 
00048 /*
00049  * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00050  * Optional outputs from the CVDIAG linear solver
00051  * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00052  *
00053  * CVDiagGetWorkSpace returns the real and integer workspace used
00054  *                    by CVDIAG.
00055  * CVDiagGetNumRhsEvals returns the number of calls to the user
00056  *                      f routine due to finite difference Jacobian
00057  *                      evaluation.
00058  *                      Note: The number of diagonal approximate
00059  *                      Jacobians formed is equal to the number of
00060  *                      CVDiagSetup calls. This number is available
00061  *                      through CVodeGetNumLinSolvSetups.
00062  * CVDiagGetLastFlag returns the last error flag set by any of
00063  *                   the CVDIAG interface functions.
00064  *
00065  * The return value of CVDiagGet* is one of:
00066  *    CVDIAG_SUCCESS   if successful
00067  *    CVDIAG_MEM_NULL  if the cvode memory was NULL
00068  *    CVDIAG_LMEM_NULL if the cvdiag memory was NULL
00069  * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00070  */
00071 
00072 int CVDiagGetWorkSpace(void *cvode_mem, long int *lenrwLS, long int *leniwLS);
00073 int CVDiagGetNumRhsEvals(void *cvode_mem, long int *nfevalsLS);
00074 int CVDiagGetLastFlag(void *cvode_mem, int *flag);
00075 
00076 /*
00077  * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00078  * The following function returns the name of the constant 
00079  * associated with a CVDIAG return flag
00080  * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00081  */
00082   
00083 char *CVDiagGetReturnFlagName(int flag);
00084 
00085 /*
00086  * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00087  * CVDIAG return values
00088  * -----------------------------------------------------------------
00089  */
00090 
00091 #define CVDIAG_SUCCESS          0
00092 #define CVDIAG_MEM_NULL        -1
00093 #define CVDIAG_LMEM_NULL       -2
00094 #define CVDIAG_ILL_INPUT       -3
00095 #define CVDIAG_MEM_FAIL        -4
00096 
00097 /* Additional last_flag values */
00098 
00099 #define CVDIAG_INV_FAIL        -5
00100 #define CVDIAG_RHSFUNC_UNRECVR -6
00101 #define CVDIAG_RHSFUNC_RECVR   -7
00102 
00103 #ifdef __cplusplus
00104 }
00105 #endif
00106 
00107 #endif
